p: The yield of essential oil was 0.5% (w/v) based on fresh weight. The essential oil was yellowish with a distinct sharp odor. Forty-six constituents in the essential oil of P. orientalis were identified corresponding to 97.88% of the total oil ( Table 1). The major components of P. orientalis oil were identified as α-Pinene (20.17%), 3-Carene (14%) and Cedrol (9.51%). Other minor constituents were found to be β-Thujene (7.85%), Terpinolene (6.56%) and α-Terpinyl acetate (4.38%).
